utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, will you steam my uniform next?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. Do you recall this conversation? Leonard, want to go halfsies on a steamer? No, Sheldon, we don’t need a steamer. Looks like that rumpled chicken’s come home to roost.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. Here are the make-up sponges you asked for.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, thanks, I thought I had more.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Damn, you’ve got more makeup than I do. You’ve got better makeup than I do. Yeah, I’m borrowing this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, hey. This is my Comic-Con makeup. I love you, but there are some things a man doesn’t share with his girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a wise policy. I once borrowed my sister’s makeup for a costume contest. Got a terrible case of pinkeye. But luckily, I was going as a zombie. I won second place.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I feel like you guys just went to Comic-Con.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was San Diego Comic-Con. This is Bakersfield Comic-Con.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is that better?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it’s a lot smaller. It’s more about the comic books. The way these conventions used to be before they went all Hollywood.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So to answer your question, no, it’s not better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, then why are you going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a comic book convention. You know, it’s like pizza or particle accelerators, even the stinky one’s still pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Well, you guys have fun. I guess I’ll see you Sunday night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hang on a second. Hold this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What was that for?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To show people when they don’t believe me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, this is the best. You have booze with breakfast on a Tuesday, you got a problem. You do it on the weekend, you got brunch.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon doesn’t believe in brunch. He can’t stand being at a table where one person’s having an omelette and another person’s having a sandwich.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s not exhausting at all.

utterance.speaker: Penny (receiving text)
utterance.content: Oh. It’s Leonard. He says they’re on the road and headed for Bakersfield at warp speed. Maybe it’s the mimosa, but I’m gonna give the kid an LOL.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s cute how excited they are. You should have seen Howard sewing his costume all week for the convention.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: When did Howard learn to sew?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: When he was a little boy, every couple months, he would have to let his mom’s pants out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t even understand why they go to these conventions.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. The four of them work at a major university. They’re all super smart. How can they still be into something made for 12-year-olds?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t mind it. I think Howie’s just in touch with his inner child. Although when he comes to bed in his Batman pyjamas, sometimes it feels like I’m touching his inner child.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s probably because they were bullied growing up. In a world where you can’t fight back, superheroes provide meaningful wish-fulfillment.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmmm. Now I feel bad for picking on all those kids. Although, in my defence, if Danny Biffle didn’t want to eat a mouthful of dirt, he shouldn’t have shown up to school wearing a bow tie.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ve never even read a comic book. You guys?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh-uh.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I mean, it’s such an important part of their lives. Maybe we should try reading some.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The comic book store isn’t far from here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is an amazing idea. Okay, how many of these have I had?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think you should turn on the GPS.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It is on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But the turn-by-turn voice option isn’t on. I know I’d feel more safe if you turn on the turn-by-turn voice option. I love the turn-by-turn voice option.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Has it really only been ten miles?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m turning it on, but just to shut you up.

utterance.speaker: GPS (in Sheldon’s voice)
utterance.content: Leonard, bear left and continue on Interstate 210.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh, sounds like that fellow knows what he’s talking about. I’d put on my listening ears if I were you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I found a hack online. I was able to upload MP3 recordings of my voice to your GPS.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That is so cool.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Counterpoint, no, it’s not.

utterance.speaker: GPS
utterance.content: Continue on Interstate 210 for five miles. Here’s an interesting fact about interstates.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shh, he said it’s interesting.

utterance.speaker: GPS
utterance.content: Interstates are numbered as follows. Even-numbered routes run east and west, odd-numbered routes run north and south. Three-digit route numbers indicate bypasses or spurs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, Leonard, there’s a bridge. Drive off it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, we’re not that far from Vazquez Rocks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, they shot a lot of Star Trek episodes out there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’ve got our costumes in the trunk. We could go there and have a little photo shoot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great idea. I haven’t had a carbohydrate in two weeks. These cheekbones need to be in front of a camera before I eat a pretzel and they’re gone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that sounds fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, smashing. Now, Leonard, do you know how to get there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well luckily, someone in the car does.

utterance.speaker: GPS
utterance.content: Recalculating. While we’re waiting, do you know which president signed the Intestate Highway System Act into law? The answer, coming up in 14 miles.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: None of you will get it. It’s Eisenhower.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why are they staring?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who cares? Just soak it in. Hello, boys.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, hey. Could you please stop staring? They’re just girls. It’s nothing you haven’t seen in movies or in drawings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What brings you guys here?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We were looking for a recommendation about comic books.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, well, I recommend you don’t open a store and sell them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, we were just wondering why the guys like this stuff so much, so we thought we’d give it a try.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, okay. What do you think you might be into? Superhero, fantasy, graphic novels, manga… I swear I will turn a hose on you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What kind of comics do the guys like?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Um, a little bit of everything. Mostly superhero stuff.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, well, who’s the best superhero?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Shh! You can’t ask a question like that in here. Are you trying to start a rumble?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well then, what do you recommend?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, uh, let’s see. You’ve got your basic clean-cut good guys, Superman, Spider-Man, Captain America. Then you have your darker anti-heroes, your Batman, your Wolverine, Punisher.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh, I do love a bad boy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: As evidenced by your boyfriend and his fear of hamsters.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: If I were you, I’d go for Fables number one. The artwork is sophisticated, it’s intelligently written, and it doesn’t objectify or stereotype women.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, Thor! He’s hot.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, he kind of is.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And we’re blending, and we’re blending, and we’re done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know Mr. Data isn’t supposed to smile, but here it comes.

utterance.speaker: Howard (dressed as a Borg)
utterance.content: Come on, guys. Let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (dressed as Captain Picard)
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sweating my bald cap off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So what’s our first pose going to be?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I say we begin with a classic Star Trek fight scene.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll set the timer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, how is that a fight pose?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mr. Data’s weapon is his mind. I’m wielding it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Phasers on the Borg! Charlie’s Angels.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, what’s next?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now let’s do some sexy glamour shots. I’ll set the mood. Oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, Yeah, nice one, oontz, oontz. That’s right. Oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Leonard, someone’s stealing your car!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? Hey, hey! Come back here!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Stop!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stealing is against the law!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll call 911. What, oh, no, my phone is in my other pants.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, so is mine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mine, too. Anybody got any ideas?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nope. The only thing left to do now is assign blame. Nice going.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What kind of a person steals another person’s car in broad daylight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What kind of person leaves his keys in the car?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought we agreed this was all Koothrappali’s fault.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re right. Nice going.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Car.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is wrong with people? Why don’t they stop?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe we’re better off. What if we were to get in a car with a crazy person?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look at us, Sheldon. We’re the crazy people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, perhaps we should hold up a sign that assures passing motorists of our mental competence.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good idea. Why don’t you get started on that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, let’s just start walking. There’s got to be a gas station or something nearby.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, you think just because you’re wearing a captain’s uniform, you’re in charge?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hmm, okay, I’m done. How did you guys finish so fast?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know, there were a lot of pictures, and one page only had the word brakkadoom!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I have street smarts.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, what’d you guys think?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, there was a lot of action.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And the story moved along at a brisk pace. It was, overall, what’s the word I’m looking for?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Stupid?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So stupid.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know how Leonard can get so caught up in this.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s crazy, they spend hours arguing about things that don’t even exist.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. A hammer so heavy that no one else can pick it up?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t think it’s heavy. It’s some sort of magic, so only Thor can lift it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That makes even less sense, I mean…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, no, no, it doesn’t. Thor is a god. The hammer is his, only he can use it. It’s like Sheldon and his toothbrush. Or his thin, beckoning lips.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, hang on, what if Thor’s hand is on the hammer? I mean, if he’s touching it with his god magic, does that mean I could lift it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, which is it?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe we missed something.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Let’s read it again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You want some tea?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good idea. I’ll help you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, I thought we were reading.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We are. We’re just, uh, giving you a head start.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I wish my mom was here. We could all hang out in her shadow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wool pants in the desert. I feel like I’ve got poached testicles.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you poor thing, you’re sweating. That’s so much worse than having your car stolen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Insurance is gonna buy you a new car. It’s not gonna de-funk my junk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, a little less bellyaching. We’re Starfleet officers and a member of the Borg Collective.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Please, Sheldon, I am so not in the mood.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, all our lives we have dreamed of finding ourselves inside one of the fantasy worlds we love. And look at us. At this moment, we are, in fact, a Star Trek landing party stranded in an alien and unforgiving environment, relying only on our wits, our fortitude and our moxie. As long as we have those things, nothing can stop…

utterance.speaker: Guys in Passing Car (throwing a drink over Sheldon)
utterance.content: Nerds!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hate this planet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It says right here on the hammer, whoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hold on, who decides who’s worthy? Does the hammer decide?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No! It can’t decide. It’s a hammer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You said it’s a magic hammer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, but, it can’t make decisions.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If Harry Potter’s wand can make decisions, why can’t Thor’s hammer?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, if you’re going to start comparing wands and hammers, I can’t even take you seriously.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. Hello. Uh, uh, uh, four glasses of water, please. Anything for you guys?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can I use your phone? Our car got stolen.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: Why don’t you ask Scotty to beam you up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Scotty was on the original series, and we’re Next Generation. So, joke’s on you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re not with him.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You can’t pick something up in outer space. In space, there is no up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Then how does the sun come up every day?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hard to argue with those kind of street smarts.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Leonard and Sheldon have boxes of comics across the hall. Why don’t we go look at those?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, great. Yes. And then you will see, I am not wrong, because if we were in outer space, then anyone could pick up the hammer because it would be floating around in a weightless environment. Yeah, that’s right, the slow reader used science. Suck on that.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Was there anything valuable in the car?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Our clothes, our wallets, phones.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And about three hundred dollars worth of makeup, so this thief could look like anyone right now.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Makeup? Sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, we’re going to the Comic-Con in Bakersfield. They have a big costume contest. It’s cooler than it sounds.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: I don’t know, sounds pretty cool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It, it is. It’s not just comic books. They’ve got action figures, toys, a Tron-themed dance party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, he gets how cool it is.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: I think I have all I need here. You guys need me to call someone? I’m guessing your moms?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks, but we’ve got it covered.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I just talked to my mom. She arranged for us to get a rental car.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great. We can still make it to Comic-Con.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? After all we’ve been through, I just want to go home.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t be like that. Come on, Howard, talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m with Leonard. I’m done.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine, then I guess it’s two against two. How do we decide?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, it’s three against one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? What about the mission? You said we were a real-life landing party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, we’re not. We’re an imaginary landing party who had real-life garbage thrown at us by real-life strangers who think we’re idiots. And to tell you the truth, I’m starting to feel like one. I want to go home now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. Did we at least rent the car from Enterprise? Get it? Enterprise? Screw you. That’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, what if the Hulk picked up Thor while Thor is holding the hammer?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Then by the transitive property of picking things up, Hulk picked up the hammer.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. Hulk picked up Thor, Thor picked up the hammer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, hang on. If I go to a bar and pick up a guy, and he picks up a girl, and then we all leave together, did I pick up the girl?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did that ever happen?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, are we talking about me or are we talking about Thor?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I say that’s the last time we ever go outside.

utterance.speaker: Amy (off)
utterance.content: Look, right here. Red Hulk is picking up Thor’s hammer ’cause Thor’s touching it.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: No, it’s because they’re in space. He’s really just touching the strap.

utterance.speaker: Amy(off)
utterance.content: The strap is part of the hammer.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (off)
utterance.content: No, it’s not!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are they actually arguing about comic books?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, that can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe Thor’s Hammer is a new colour of nail polish.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (off)
utterance.content: Then Red Hulk must be worthy.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: How could Red Hulk be worthy?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (off)
utterance.content: You don’t know his life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s only one logical explanation. Somewhere in the desert we crossed into an alternate dimension where the women in our lives can finally appreciate great literature.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If it’s an alternate dimension, sounds like a job for a landing party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Captain, what are your orders?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I say we investigate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. They might be hostile.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, but set them to stun. If we vaporize Penny, I’ll never find a girlfriend that pretty again.

utterance.speaker: GPS
utterance.content: Fun fact, President Eisenhower signed the Federal Aid Highway Act from his hospital room.

utterance.speaker: First Car Thief
utterance.content: Wow, that is interesting.

utterance.speaker: Second Car Thief
utterance.content: You learn something new every day.

utterance.speaker: GPS
utterance.content: Say, can you name the four state capitols that are not served by the interstate system?

utterance.speaker: First Car Thief
utterance.content: Ooh, another quiz.

utterance.speaker: Second Car Thief
utterance.content: Yes!
